inference:
Let the common ratio be \(k\). Then $VY=4k$ and $YW=3k$. Therefore, \(k=\frac{VW}{7}\).
$$\Rightarrow\qquad VY=\frac{4}{7}VW\text{ and }YW=\frac{3}{7}VW$$

Now, $$\text{Area of }\triangle PYW=\frac{1}{2}PY\cdot WY=\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{4}{7}VW\cdot\frac{3}{7}VW=30$$ $$\Rightarrow\qquad \frac{12}{49}VW^2=30\Rightarrow VW^2=122.5$$ $$\Rightarrow\qquad VW=\sqrt{122.5}=11$$

Therefore, 
$$\text{Area of }\triangle PZW=\frac{1}{2}PW\cdot WZ=\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{3}{7}VW\cdot\frac{4}{7}VW=35$$ $$\Rightarrow\qquad \frac{12}{49}VW^2=35\Rightarrow VW^2=143.75$$ $$\Rightarrow\qquad VW=\sqrt{143.75}=11.98$$

Finally, 
$$\text{Area of }\triangle PUX=\frac{1}{2}PU\cdot UX=\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{3}{7}VW\cdot\frac{5}{7}VW$$ $$=\frac{15}{98}VW^2=\frac{15}{98}\cdot143.75=\frac{2156.25}{98}=22$$

**Final Answer: \(\boxed{22}\). I hope it is correct.**

$$\text{Area of }\triangle PUX=\frac{1}{2}PU\cdot UX=\frac{1}{2}\cdot\frac{3}{7}VW\cdot\frac{5}{7}VW$$ $$=\frac{15}{98}VW^2=\frac{15}{98}\cdot143.75=\frac{2156.25}{98}=22$$
